comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1.  Create a new new BPEL project and file.
2.  Drag an Assign action from the palette to the editor.
3.  Click the Details tab in the Properties view.
4.  Attempt to assign from one variable to another, or from an expression to a variable.
5.  Click anywhere in the the editor (sometimes the error isn't displayed until you transfer focus away from the Properties view).

Notice that an error dialog is displayed.  If you look in the log file you will see one or more NullPointerExceptions.


More information:
Stacktraces from the log file:

I have been doing some surgery here. 

I have just checked in slightly re-worked/refactored AssignCategory code to allow for variable initialization constructs. I believe this no longer happens.
I'm sorry to report that this is still failing.  I'd be happy to provide additional information if needed.

Jonathan, is this the case with the current current tip (as of today lets say) ? 
Can you post the stack trace ?
Also, can you confirm you are using MacOS X ?

Here is a stacktrace from a current (June 27, 2007) build.  I am using Mac OS X but I am fairly certain this is not a platform-specific issue.  I can test on Windows if it would be helpful.

okey dokey ... now I get it. You were not creating an copy rule first. 
That was the major null pointer exception issue. Now you have to create the copy rule first (the New button). 

I just checked in the fix... hopefully this covers it.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
